description: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.
descriptionMD: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.__This course has been CAQC'd and qualifies for CEU credits. [Click here](https://itpro.tv/comptia-partnership) to get an exam voucher discount.__
name: CompTIA A+ (220-902)
subtitle: Vendor-neutral hardware and software technologies

episodes.description: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast various features of Microsoft Operating Systems (Vista/7/8/8.1). Specific topics covered includes: Architecture (32/64 bit), Windows Aero, and Gadgets.
episodes.title: Features of Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast various features of Microsoft Operating Systems (Vista/7/8/8.1). Specific topics covered includes: User Account Control(UAC), BitLocker, Shadow Copy, and System Restore.
episodes.title: Features of Windows Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast various features of Microsoft Operating Systems (Vista/7/8/8.1). Specific topics covered includes: Ready Boost, Compatibility Mode, Virtual XP Mode, Easy Transfer, Administrative Tools, Defender, Windows Firewall, and Security Center.
episodes.title: Features of Windows Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast various features of Microsoft Operating Systems (Vista/7/8/8.1). Specific topics covered includes: Event viewer, File structure and paths, category/classic view, side-by-side apps, Metro UI, Pinning, One Drive, Windows Store, Charms, Start Screen, Powershell, Live Sign-in, and Action Center.
episodes.title: Features of Windows Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes demonstrate how to install the Windows operating system using the appropriate methods. Here they talk specifically about: boot methods like usb, cd-rom, dvd, and PXE as well as unattended installations.
episodes.title: Installing Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes demonstrate how to install the Windows operating system using the appropriate methods. Here they talk specifically about: Clean installations, upgrade installations, Windows post-installation walkthrough, recovery partitions, and device drivers.
episodes.title: Installing Windows Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes demonstrate how to install the Windows operating system using the appropriate methods. Here they talk specifically about: Workgroup and Domain setups, initializing upgrade installs, upgrade paths, file systems, and drive partitions.
episodes.title: Installing Windows Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore using Microsoft command-line based tools. Here they will show you how to navigate your way around Microsoft Windows using the Command Prompt and manipulating the directory structure using MD to make a new folder.
episodes.title: Microsoft Command Prompt

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore using Microsoft command-line based tools. Here they will show you more directory manipulation through using RD to remove directories, copying files/directories with the copy/xcopy/robocopy commands, view running processes with tasklist, and stop specific processes using taskkill. Other CLI tools demonstrated includes: Shutdown and bootrec.
episodes.title: Microsoft Command Prompt Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore using Microsoft command-line based tools. They wrap up by looking at commands like format, diskpart, chkdsk, sfc, gpupdate, gpresult, exit, help, and expand.
episodes.title: Microsoft Command Prompt Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes use appropriate Microsoft operating system features and tools. Specific tools and features covered here includes: Computer Management, Device Manager, Local Users and Groups, and Task Scheduler.
episodes.title: Windows Tools

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes use appropriate Microsoft operating system features and tools. Specific tools and features covered here includes: Local Security Policy, Performance Monitor, and Services.
episodes.title: Windows Tools Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes use appropriate Microsoft operating system features and tools. Specific tools and features covered here includes: Microsoft System Configuration(MSCONFIG) utility.
episodes.title: Windows Tools Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes use appropriate Microsoft operating system features and tools. Specific tools and features covered here includes: Component Services, Data Sources, Print Management, Windows Memory Diagnostic, and Windows Firewall/Advanced Security.
episodes.title: Windows Tools Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes use appropriate Microsoft operating system features and tools. Specific tools and features covered here includes: Task Manager, Disk Management, Registry Editor, Notepad, MMC, Remote Desktop, Explorer, MSINFO32, DXDIAG, DEFRAG, System Restore, and Windows Update.
episodes.title: Windows Tools Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes take you through commonly used Windows Control Panel utilities. Specific tools looked at includes: Internet Options (Connections, Security Zones, Security Levels, Protected Mode, General, Privacy, Programs, etc).
episodes.title: Control Panel Utilities

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes take you through commonly used Windows Control Panel utilities. Specific tools looked at includes: Display settings, User Accounts, Folder Options, System, Windows Firewall, and Power Options.
episodes.title: Control Panel Utilities Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes install and configure Windows networking on a client desktop. Here the guys will show you how to: Join a Windows Domain and mapping a network drive.
episodes.title: Windows Client Networking

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes install and configure Windows networking on a client desktop. Here the guys will show you how to: setup printer sharing and mapping a networked printer, establish networking connections, and proxy settings.
episodes.title: Windows Client Networking Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes install and configure Windows networking on a client desktop. Here the guys will show you how to: Remote Desktop Connections, Home vs. Work vs. Public Networks, Firewall Settings, and Remote Assistance.
episodes.title: Windows Client Networking Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes install and configure Windows networking on a client desktop. Here the guys will show you how to: configure an alternative IP address and network interface card(NIC) properties like duplex speeds, Wake-on-LAN(WOL), Quality of Service(QoS), and onboard NICs.
episodes.title: Windows Client Networking Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes discuss preventive maintenance procedures using the appropriate Windows OS tools. Specific topics covered here includes: Taking and scheduling backups in Windows 7 and 8.1.
episodes.title: Preventive Maintenance Procedures

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes discuss preventive maintenance procedures using the appropriate Windows OS tools. Specific topics covered here includes: chkdsk, Disk Defrag, drive optimization, performing updates/patch management, system restore, disk management, recovery images, diskpart, sfc, and disk cleanup.
episodes.title: Preventive Maintenance Procedures Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes identify common features and functionality of the Mac OS and Linux operating systems. Specific topics covered here includes: Open Source, GPL, GNU, Linux history, Backup solutions, disk maintenance, Spotlight for Mac, system updates/patch management.
episodes.title: Mac OS and Linux Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes identify common features and functionality of the Mac OS and Linux operating systems. Specific topics covered here includes: AntiMalware/Antivirus software, Time Machine, Restore/snapshot, image recovery, multiple desktops, gestures, Finder, Remote Disc, iCloud, Key Chain, Force Quit, and Bootcamp.
episodes.title: Mac OS and Linux Features Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes identify common features and functionality of the Mac OS and Linux operating systems. Specific topics covered here includes: Basic Linux commands (ls, grep, cd, shutdown, pwd, passwd, mv, cp, rm, chmod, chown, ifconfig/iwconfig, ps, sudo/su, apt-get, vi, man, and dd)
episodes.title: Mac OS and Linux Features Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain, setup, and use Client-Side Virtualization. Specific topics covered here includes: Virtualization defined, purpose of using virtualization, resource requirements, hypervisor explanation, networking in VMs, and emulation vs. virtualization.
episodes.title: Client-side Virtualization

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore and identify basic cloud concepts. Here they cover cloud concepts like cloud types like Software as a Service(SaaS), Infrastructure as a Service(IaaS), and Platform as a Service(PaaS), Private/Public/Hybrid/Community cloud types, Elasticity, and Resource Pooling.
episodes.title: Basic Cloud Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes summarize the properties and purpose of services provided by networked hosts. Specific topics covered here includes: Server Roles like Mail, Web, and Print servers, Internet Appliances like IDS, IPS, and UTMs, and Legacy/Embedded Systems.
episodes.title: Networked Hosts Services

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes take a look at mobile device data and syncing that data. Here they explore the types of data on mobile devices (email/apps/pictures/music/etc), Sync locations, Single Sign-On(SSO) implementations, and connection types.
episodes.title: Mobile Operating System Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look at installing and configuring basic mobile device network connectivity and email. Specific topics covered here includes: Wireless and Cellular data networks, Bluetooth, Corporate and ISP email, Commercial email configuration, PRI/PRL/Baseband updates, IMEI vs IMSI, VPNs, and Synchronizable data.
episodes.title: Mobile Device Connectivity, Email and Syncing

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look at installing and configuring basic mobile device network connectivity and email. Specific topics covered here includes: Wireless and Cellular data networks, Bluetooth, Corporate and ISP email, Commercial email configuration, PRI/PRL/Baseband updates, IMEI vs IMSI, VPNs, and Synchronizable data.
episodes.title: Mobile Device Connectivity, Email, Syncing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes identify common security threats and vulnerabilities. Specifics threats and vulnerabilities covered includes: Malware, Social Engineering, Zero-day Attacks, Spoofing, Man-in-the-Middle Attacks, Zombies/Botnets, Password Attacks, Non-Compliant systems, and Best-Practices violations.
episodes.title: Threats and Vulnerabilities

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast common prevention methods with regards to digital and physical security. Specific methods discussed includes: Door locks, Mantraps, biometrics, ID badges, Tokens, Antivirus, Firewalls, Cable locks, Key Fobs, Smart Cards, Multifactor Authentication, Directory Permissions, Privacy Filters, and Password Policies.
episodes.title: Common Prevention Methods

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast differences of basic Windows OS security settings. Specific topics discussed here includes: Users and Groups, NTFS permissions.
episodes.title: Windows Security Settings

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast differences of basic Windows OS security settings. Specific topics discussed here includes: File Attributes and Share permissions.
episodes.title: Windows Security Settings Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast differences of basic Windows OS security settings. Specific topics discussed here includes: BitLocker, BitLocker-to-Go, Encrypted File System(EFS), and User Authentication
episodes.title: Windows Security Settings Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes show you how to deploy and enforce security best practices to secure a workstation. Here they will walk you through Password best practices like settings strong passwords, password expiration policy, change default usernames/passwords, screensaver passwords, and password requirements.
episodes.title: Workstation Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes show you how to deploy and enforce security best practices to secure a workstation. Here they will walk you through Account Management, BIOS/UEFI Passwords, Data encryption, and Patch/Update Management.
episodes.title: Workstation Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast various methods for securing mobile devices. Specific topic covered here includes: Screen locks, Remote wipes, Locator apps, Remote Backup apps, Failed login restrictions, patching, biometrics, multi-factor authentication, encryption, remote wipes, etc.
episodes.title: Securing Mobile Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look at common/appropriate data destruction and disposal methods. Specific topics covered here includes: Physical destruction (shredding/drilling/hammering/magnetic) and Recycling/Repurposing best practices (formatting/overwriting/wiping).
episodes.title: Data Destruction and Disposal

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore best practices for securing a SOHO network. Specific topics covered here includes: Wireless specific security, using static IPs, MAC filtering, firewall settings, update firmware, and physical security.
episodes.title: Securing SOHO Networks

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss troubleshooting operating systems problems with appropriate tools, proprietary crash screens, 'NotMyFault,' checking boot sequence, preinstallation environment, hard boot vs. soft boot, missing NTLDR, Kernel panic, logs, repair disks, and event viewer.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot PC Operating Systems

episodes.description: Wes and Zach continue the discussion on trouble shooting PC operating systems, missing DLL message, boot to safe mode, leave msconfig configured for safe mode, missing boot configuration data, bootrec/RebuildBCD, BCDEdit/enum or /v, missing operating system, checking boot device, run SFC, system recovery option, missing graphical interface, graphical interface fails to load, MSCONFIG, safe mode, command prompt, and uninstall/reinstall/repair.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot PC Operating Systems Part 2

episodes.description: Wes and Zach crude the discussion on troubleshooting PC operating systems, device fails to start/detected, device manager, service fails to start, check services, startup type, mschonfig diagnostic startup, service dependency, compatibility error, checking manufacturers website, run compatibility mode, slow system performance, check for malware, check for full drive, use Performance Monitor, use Resource Monitor, missing GRUB/LILO, SFC, REGSRV32, REGEDIT, and DEFRAG.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot PC Operating Systems Part 3

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss how to troubleshoot common PC security issues with appropriate tools & best practices, common symptoms, pop-ups, browser redirection, security alerts, antivirus software, anti-malware software, disabling Windows Firewall service, pre-installation environments, and disabling Windows Defender.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot PC Security Issues

episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover slow performance, using 'NotMyFault' to create a memory leak, what is 'Paged-Non-Paged,' using Task Manager, explaining memory composition, internet connectivity issues, PC/OS lock up, application crash, OS updates failures, rogue antivirus, spam, renamed system files, files disappearing, file permission changes, hijacked email, access denied, and system restore/Snapshot.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot PC Security Issues Part 2

episodes.description: Wes and Zach conclude the discussion on Troubleshooting PC Security Issues, look at invalid certificates, recovery console, terminal, event viewer, refresh/restore, MISCONFIG/Safe boot, best practice procedure for malware removal, remediate infected systems, schedule scans & run updates, enable system restore & create restore point, and educate end user.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot PC Security Issues Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot common mobile OS and application issues with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered includes: Dim display, intermittent wireless, no wireless connectivity, no Bluetooth connectivity, and unable to broadcast to external monitor.
episodes.title: Common Mobile OS Issues

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot common mobile OS and application issues with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered includes: unresponsive touchscreen, apps not loading, slow performance, hard/soft reset, unable to decrypt email, short battery life, overheating, frozen system, sound issues, and system lockout.
episodes.title: Common Mobile OS Issues Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot common mobile OS and application security issues with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered includes: Common security breech symptoms like signal drop/weak signal, power drain, slow data speeds, unintended wireless/Bluetooth connection, leaked personal data, data transmission overlimit, and security tools.
episodes.title: Common Mobile OS Security Issues

episodes.description: Wes and Zach talk over appropriate safety procedures, equipment grounding, proper component handling/storage, antistatic bags, ESD straps/mats, toxic waste handling, personal safety, and compliance with local government regulations.
episodes.title: Safety Procedures

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss potential environmental impacts & applying appropriate controls, MSDS documentation, temperature/humidity levels, ventilation, power issues, airborne particles, dust & debris, and local government regulations.
episodes.title: Environmental Impact and Controls

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss prohibited content-prohibited activity, privacy, licensing, policy concepts, incident response, first response, identification, reporting through channels, data preservation, device preservation, use of documentation, chain of custody, tracking of evidence, documenting process, licensing, DRM, EULA, license, and Personally Identifiable Information.
episodes.title: Privacy, Licenses and Policy Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes demonstrate proper communication techniques and professionalism. Specific topics covered here includes: proper language, attitude, active listening, cultural sensitivity, punctuality, avoiding distractions, meeting timeline expectations, and dealing with private material.
episodes.title: Communication and Professionalism

episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover consideration of corporate policies/procedures/Impacts before implementing changes, identify the problem, identify symptoms of problem, determine frequency of problem, determine scope of problem, run backups, and establish theory of probable cause.
episodes.title: CompTIA's Troubleshooting Theory

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss testing the theory to determine cause, establishing a plan of action to resolve the problem & implement solution, licensing concerns, are additional costs acceptable, escalation required, verify full system functionality, implement preventative measures, re-run backups, schedule updates, and document findings.
episodes.title: CompTIA's Troubleshooting Theory Part 2
